briefTitle: Efficacy/Safety of Verteporfin Photodynamic Therapy and Ranibizumab Compared With Ranibizumab in Patients With Subfoveal Choroidal Neovascularization

armGroups.label: Verteporfin With Standard Fluence Rate Plus Ranibizumab
Verteporfin With Reduced Fluence Rate Plus Ranibizumab

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subjects of either gender age 50 years or older
* Subfoveal choroidal neovascularization (CNV) due to age-related macular degeneration (AMD)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Choroidal neovascularization due to causes other than AMD
* Prior treatment for neovascular AMD in the study eye

Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Best-corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) of the Study Eye at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: BCVA score was based on the number of letters read correctly on the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) visual acuity chart assessed at a starting distance of 4 meters. An ETDRS visual acuity score of 85 is approximately 20/20. An increase in the VA score indicates improvement in visual acuity.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Total Area of Leakage of the Study Eye at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Total area of leakage of the study eye was assessed at the Central Reading Center (CRC) using Fluorescein angiography (FA).

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients With Fluorescein Leakage in the Study Eye at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of patients with leakage of the study eye was assessed at the Central Reading Center (CRC) using Fluorescein angiography (FA).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Central Retinal Thickness at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Optical coherence tomography was performed in the study eyes and the evaluations of the images were performed by the central reading center.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients With a Treatment-free Interval of at Least 3 Months Following the Month 2 Visit
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of patients with a ranibizumab treatment-free interval, ie, no active ranibizumab treatments for at least 3 months duration (at least 2 consecutive monthly visits), anytime following the Month 2 ranibizumab treatment. Only active ranibizumab treatments were considered.
